intro: Acineta salazarii, commonly known as the Salazarii acineta, is a species of flowering plant native to South America. It belongs to the family Malvaceae and is characterized by its small, delicate flowers that typically bloom in shades of pink and white. The plant has a shrub-like growth habit with hairy stems and lance-shaped leaves. It thrives in moist, well-drained soils and is often found in forested areas. Due to its ornamental value, it is occasionally cultivated in gardens, though it remains relatively rare in horticultural trade.
